alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 4:17PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Isolated thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Cascade County through 445 PM MDT... At 416 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking isolated thunderstorms centered near Great Falls. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Black Eagle, Ulm, Malmstrom Afb, Sand Coulee, Stockett, Tracy, Vaughn, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park and Centerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
